SEARCH
Package kaiyuan.assignment.model

Interface Calculator

All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicCalculator
public interface Calculator
Defines the contract for a calculator that supports basic mathematical operations and allows chaining of multiple operations.

The Calculator interface provides methods to perform individual operations as well as to chain multiple operations on a cumulative result. It supports both single operations (through basicCalculate(Operation, Number, Number)) and chained operations where the result of one operation is used as the input for the next (through chainOperations(Operation, Number)).

This interface is designed to be flexible, allowing different implementations to support various types of numbers and operation strategies.

  • Method Details

    • basicCalculate

      Number basicCalculate(Operation operation, Number num1, Number num2)
      Performs a basic calculation with the specified operation on two numeric values.

      This method applies the given Operation (e.g., addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division) to num1 and num2, returning the result of the calculation.

      Parameters:
      operation - the operation to be performed, such as ADD, SUBTRACT, MULTIPLY, or DIVIDE
      num1 - the first operand
      num2 - the second operand
      Returns:
      the result of the operation

    • chainOperations

      Calculator chainOperations(Operation operation, Number num)
      Chains the given operation with the current state of the calculator.

      This method allows multiple operations to be performed sequentially by chaining them. Each chained operation uses the result of the previous operation (or the initial state) as the first operand, and num as the second operand.

      Parameters:
      operation - the operation to be performed
      num - the second operand for the operation
      Returns:
      the current Calculator instance, allowing for method chaining

    • getChainingResult

      Number getChainingResult()
      Returns the result of the chained operations.

      This method returns the final result of all chained operations. If no operations have been chained, it returns the initial state of the calculator.

      Returns:
      the result of the chained operations, or the initial state if no operations were chained

    • setState

      Calculator setState(Number initialState)
      Sets the initial state of the calculator.

      This method initializes the calculator with a starting value. This initial value will be used as the first operand in the first chained operation or as the result if no operations are chained.

      Parameters:
      initialState - the initial state of the calculator
      Returns:
      the current Calculator instance, allowing for method chaining
